greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ascending descending base exponent transform of omega(n) (A001221).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..5000
example: Since omega(n) = A001221(n) = 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 2 and we skip the initial zero term, we have:
mathematica: Table[Sum[PrimeNu[k]^(PrimeNu[n - k + 2]), {k, 2, n}], {n, 2, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 18 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=2,25, print1(sum(k=2,n, omega(k)^(omega(n-k+2))), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 18 2017
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jan 10 2006
ext: Corrected and extended by _Giovanni Resta_, Jun 13 2016
Formulas corrected by _G. C. Greubel_, May 18 2017
